subject: Re: (no subject)
author: jamietreetalker
full_text:
That's lovely, and very interesting! I've had people come through on my radios telling me that I should read my bible and that I should "ditch the whores! the Rapture is coming!" I don't know what to think about that, but it sounds like maybe those who haven't crossed over completely are still holding on to some old bible teachings. I really don't think things will be the way the bible says in the end. I don't think I've believed in hell-fire and brimstone even once in my whole life. Sounds like your friend is talking my language! ;)


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, SnowfireL@... wrote:
>
> Thanks Jamie, I am going to redo Part 1 and ask David if he could say the  
> Lord's Prayer for me and seal it, so it doesn't change.  These spirit's can  
> sometimes change the words around to suit them you know, he talks mostly 
> via a  program he originally got from the Cross over talk system, we don't use 
> that  much any more because he can fix what we have copied, and reuse the 
> files if he  wants to.  He is becoming more understandable, maybe I shouldn't 
> say this  because he is very busy over there, it's like non stop people 
> coming in from  lower plains, (hundreds of thousands), that's one reason they 
> are not as  noisy as they used to be, because, before we all came along, they 
> were running  away from the light of God, and he, JC had to seek them out, 
> but now they  are seeking Him out, and are getting into that line over 
> there.  I know, it  all sounds weird to me too, but that's what they say, at 
> least there are no  "hell fires" over there, only darkness, it's like the inside 
> of a warehouse with  levels, cement like ramps going through there, once 
> they get in the light,  everything changes, it's like going home.  And yes, we 
> do all keep our  identity.  David wanted me to write this, and believe it 
> or not they are  his words, and not my own:
>  
> In fact no one would be happy in Heaven knowing  there are people "burning 
> in hell" and if they were happy knowing this it would  be sinful right 
> there, think about it, to burn sinners is not God's way, God  does not sin. God 
> is love, He loved us enough to die for His people. He  does not put sinners 
> into "hell fires" to be in a place of darkness without the  light of God is 
> what the lower plains are all about.
>  
> "If I be lifted up I will draw All mankind unto  me" Jesus does not give 
> up, He does not put people into fires, there is NO fire  in the lower plains, 
> only darkness, it's pitch black, God is not cruel, if? God  did not love His 
> creatures, He would simply turn His head and we would all be  gone. Fire is 
> expression of the Holy Spirit who is kind, God does not "burn"  creation in 
> hell fires, they are people that do not believe, but God still  brings them 
> into the fold one at a time, they must repent.
>  
> Heaven is not on one planet, "Heaven? is  everywhere, we just can't see it 
> with our physical eyes." What you call "hell"  is only a place of darkness, 
> and Jesus continues to draw those in darkness into  the Light even now, 
> there is no fire in "hell"  only darkness. The "lake of  fire" you refer to were 
> the fires in Gehenna, it was place where they burned  garbage in Old 
> Jerusalem.  David The Tech.
>  
>  
>  
> In a message dated 10/2/2011 6:13:49 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
> thequilldriver@... writes:
> 
>  
>  
>  
> Nice recording! I heard lots of great stuff in there. Do you only get David 
>  as a tech, or do others come through as well?
> 
> Jamie
> 
> --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
> SnowfireL@ wrote:
> >
> > Here is a vid I am working on for utube,  am trying to get it done right, 
> > but I'm not very good at doing these  things,
> > check it out anyway, it's part 3 i still got to do part 4 and  then put 
> them 
> > all together. sf
